abstract: N.B.A. players have been carefully protecting their image as the aggrieved party in the lockout, using Twitter to apologize to fans and express sympathy for workers hurt by their labor standoff.

lead_paragraph: With the N.B.A. lockout growing nastier, players having a vehicle to unload their thoughts directly to fans is potentially an image disaster. Even before the Twitter age, it was only a matter of time until a player said something that instantly made all players look ridiculous and out of touch -- think Patrick Ewing's "Sure, we make a lot of money, but we spend a lot, too" comment that became the eye-roller of the 1999 lockout. Now, that danger is only 140 characters away.
